positive.review:
Panzer Corps 2 is an excellent strategy game built on the legacy of the classic Panzer General. 
It’s perfect for sinking hours into, with a superb campaign that guides your units through different eras of WWII. Units carry over from one campaign to the next, retaining their skills, and heroes can be attached to them for even greater impact. 

The campaign DLCs are highly recommended for the full experience, with the last two (Axis Operations 1945 and 1946) even offering an alternative history path where the war doesn’t end in 1945 but continues into 1946 with different outcomes. 

A must-play for fans of the genre and anyone who enjoys turn-based hex strategy games.
Classic and great, one of the best war strategy games out there.

A staple in the wargaming world. Easy to learn, hard to master. Definitely a good buy as there are many campaigns and additional DLCs that cover more obscure campaigns such as the German involvement in the Spanish Civil War and Operation Mercury.

Excellent all around production.. no real flaws, it has great mechanics for combat factors, deep custom difficulty and campaign settings, snappy UI, unit/maps all look great ..
 A masterpiece for it's specific strategic/tactical scale.
Nice game. Enjoying it so far. Just needed to review the manual carefully to see the changes.
Its been a good game to keep.  And it has good replay ability.
Improvement over  PC1 in almost every way.
A great "beer and pretzels" game!
Best Strategy Game
the history

That's what I call a good game.

Good looking, fun turn by turn game. Easy to play for a couple minutes when you are in between stuff.

The campaign can be replayed with different theater so I suppose you can at least play it two time without much repetition (if not more). Beating it the first time took me a good 80h+ so good value there.

Something I found particularly interesting is the fact that you play Germany and while you win your battles your still facing the inevitable fact that your losing the war. It gives you a special point of views that few other games offer.

So I recommend it for some good relaxing gameplay time.

I cannot recommend this game more if you are a WWII game fan.  The DLC for the main game (Axis Operations) adds a huge value to the playing experience.  The game has enough challenge to keep you coming back for more.  If you put enough randomization into the campaign, no two play throughs will be the same.  Get the base game and AO and you have hundreds or more hours of playing time available to you.

really nice throw back to  Panzer General childhood memories, beautiful graphics with some nice new mechanics.
would like to have grand campaign on whole world scale, not just european scenarios

The game was good but has now gone the queer route.
They have inserted the fag flag in several countries flags.

Worst game ever
The original panzer corps 1 was great it was using 2D and an isometric view 
Then flashback the designer decided to use a :@@ 3D engine without them having any knowledge on how to do it properly. 
The outcome? 
A bugged game during the first year after its release the game was unplayable. 
Afterwards? 
Bc the new rule system is different to the original and now it doesn't make any sense Even if the game will launch (players need a quantum or a nasa computer to make it happen...) the game can't be played at all GUI feels unresponsive rules r a :@ graphics r the worst even compared to panzer 3D the original from SSI. 
I won't recommend this game at all. I felt deceived by both the designer and the publisher 
I will only recommend it if someone gives it for free is a massive :#
The worst is the game engine and graphics engine 
The designer needs to learn the hard way if something work do not change it! 
There was no need to move to 3d especially when u dont have either the capabilities or the team able to design such a feat
Has Pride Insignia. Beyond that, other games of this nature have superior mechanics.
